block.p: Anne Willard Rouse, a daughter of Emma Martin Halpert of Philadelphia and Willard G. Rouse III of Phoenixville, Pa., was married yesterday to Matthew Pratt Sudduth, a son of Charlotte Pratt Sudduth of Marion, Mass., and Dr. S. Scott Sudduth of Newfields, N.H. The Rev. Robert W. Woodroofe III, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at the Bretton Woods Chapel in Bretton Woods, N.H.

Mrs. Sudduth, 29, was until June the senior vice president for education at the New York City Partnership, the business and civic organization. She is a director of Partnership With Children, a New York social services organization. She graduated from Brown University. Her father is the chairman of Liberty Property Trust, a real estate development company in Malvern, Pa. Her mother is the director of the special programs division of the College of General Studies at the University of Pennsylvania in Philadelphia.

Anne Willard Rouse, a daughter of Emma Martin Halpert of Philadelphia and Willard G. Rouse III of Phoenixville, Pa., was married yesterday to Matthew Pratt Sudduth, a son of Charlotte Pratt Sudduth of Marion, Mass., and Dr. S. Scott Sudduth of Newfields, N.H. The Rev. Robert W. Woodroofe III, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at the Bretton Woods Chapel in Bretton Woods, N.H.

Mrs. Sudduth, 29, was until June the senior vice president for education at the New York City Partnership, the business and civic organization. She is a director of Partnership With Children, a New York social services organization. She graduated from Brown University. Her father is the chairman of Liberty Property Trust, a real estate development company in Malvern, Pa. Her mother is the director of the special programs division of the College of General Studies at the University of Pennsylvania in Philadelphia.

The bride's stepfather, Michael Halpert, is the chief executive of PhilHide, a Philadelphia company that trades animal hides, wheat and other commodities. Her stepmother, Susannah Rouse, founded and directs the African Elephant Conservation Trust in Malvern, a protection program working in Nairobi and Kenya. The bride is a grandniece of the late James Rouse, who oversaw the renovation and development of Faneuil Hall in Boston and the South Street Seaport in New York. She is a descendant of Chief Justice John Marshall.

Mr. Sudduth, 29, graduated from Bates College and is a candidate for an M.B.A. at Columbia University. He was a stock analyst at Mark Asset Management in New York until last October. His mother is a director of Habitat for Humanity in Marion, Mass. His father is a gynecologist and partner at Partners for Women's Health, a practice in Exeter, N.H. The bridegroom's stepmother, Gail R. Sudduth, is the psychologist for Sanborn Regional High School in Kingston, N.H. The bridegroom is a descendant of Charles Pratt, the founder of Pratt Institute in Brooklyn.
